sen.j: 八景（はっけい）とは、ある地域における八つの優れた風景を選ぶ、風景評価の様式。
sen.e: Eight Views is a manner of scenery valuation in which eight finest sceneries of the region are selected.
Eight Views is a manner of scenery valuation in which eight finest sceneries of the region are selected.
Eight Views is a manner of scenery valuation in which eight finest sceneries of the region are selected.

sen.j: 10世紀に北宋で選ばれた瀟湘八景がモデルとなり、影響を受けた台湾、朝鮮、日本など東アジア各地で八景が選定されてきた。
sen.e: On the model of Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang which were selected in Baisong in the 10th century, Eight Views have been selected under its influence in various places of East Asia, including Taiwan, Korea, Japan and so on.

On the model of Eight Views of Xiaoxiang which were selected in Baisong in the 10th century, Eight Views have been selected under its influence in various places of East Asia, including Taiwan, Korea, Japan and so on.

On the model of Eight Views of Xiaoxiang which were selected in Baisong in the 10th century, Eight Views have been selected under its influence in various places of East Asia, including Taiwan, Korea, Japan and so on.

sen.j: なお八景以外にも、四景、十景、十二景などの例も見られる。
sen.e: In addition to Eight Views, there are examples of Four Views, Ten Views, 12 Views and so on.
In addition to Eight Views, there are examples of Four Views, Ten Views, Twelve Views and so on.
In addition to Eight Views, there are examples of Four Views, Ten Views, Twelve Views and so on.

sen.j: 八景は瀟湘八景のように対象が固定されているものも多いが、台湾八景のように時代とともに内容が変遷するものもある。
sen.e: In many cases Eight Views, like Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang, consists of fixed subjects, but there are also the ones which change the contents as times change, like Taiwan Eight Views.
In many cases Eight Views, like the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, consist of fixed subjects, but there are also the ones whose targets vary across the ages, like Eight Views of Taiwan.
In many cases Eight Views, like the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, consist of fixed subjects, but there are also the ones whose targets vary across the ages, like Eight Views of Taiwan.

sen.j: また、8つの風景の組み合わせは瀟湘八景をなぞらえている場合と、知名度の高い名所を中心に選出した場合がある。
sen.e: Sometimes the combination of eight sceneries is patterned after Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang, and sometimes it is a selection of mainly well-known scenic spots.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sometimes the combination of eight sceneries is patterned after the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, and sometimes it is a selection of mainly well-known scenic spots.
Sometimes the combination of eight sceneries is patterned after the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, and sometimes it is a selection of mainly well-known scenic spots.

sen.j: 近年では後者が増えている。
sen.e: In recent years the latter case is increasing.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In recent years the latter case is increasing.
In recent years the latter case is increasing.

sen.j: 前者のような伝統的な形式では、八景を構成する個々の項目は、風景の対象地とそこでの事象や事物を組み合わせている。
sen.e: In the former case of traditional manner, each head which constitutes Eight Views is a combination of the place for the scenery and the phenomenon or object there.
In the former case of the traditional style, each component of Eight Views is a combination of the place for the scenery and the phenomenon or object there.
In the former case of the traditional style, each component of Eight Views is a combination of the place for the scenery and the phenomenon or object there.

sen.j: 事象・事物の内容は瀟湘八景をそのまま踏襲し、下記の8つとする場合（例：近江八景）や、一部を同じものにする場合（例：最初の台湾八景）がある。
sen.e: In some cases (example: the Eight Views of Omi) the contents of phenomena and objects for Eight Views completely follow Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang and are fixed on the following eight, and in other cases (example: the earliest Taiwan Eight Views) only a part of the contents is the same as Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang.

In some cases (e.g. the Eight Views of Omi) the contents of phenomena and objects for Eight Views completely follow the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang and are fixed on the following eight, and in other cases (e.g. the earliest Eight Views of Taiwan) only a part of the contents is the same as the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang.

In some cases (e.g. the Eight Views of Omi) the contents of phenomena and objects for Eight Views completely follow the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang and are fixed on the following eight, and in other cases (e.g. the earliest Eight Views of Taiwan) only a part of the contents is the same as the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang.

sen.j: 霞：本来は春または秋の霞。
sen.e: Haze: originally it is a haze of spring or autumn.
Haze: originally it is spring or fall haze.
Haze: originally it is spring or fall haze.

sen.j: 青嵐と混同して強風としたり、嵐の後の凪とする例もある。
sen.e: There are examples in which haze is replaced by big wind, because it is mistaken for wind blowing through verdure, or replaced by calm after a storm.
There are examples in which haze is replaced by big wind, because it is mistaken for wind blowing through verdure, or replaced by calm after a storm.
There are examples in which haze is replaced by big wind, because it is mistaken for wind blowing through verdure, or replaced by calm after a storm.

sen.j: 鐘：沈む夕焼けと山中の寺院の鐘楼の組み合わせ。
sen.e: Temple bell: a combination of the evening glow with the setting sun and Shoro (a bell tower) of a temple in a mountain.
Temple bell: a combination of the evening glow with the setting sun and a belfry of a temple in the mountain.
Temple bell: a combination of the evening glow with the setting sun and a belfry of a temple in the mountain.

sen.j: 雨：夜中に降る雨の風景。
sen.e: Rain: a scene of the rain in the night.
Rain: a scene of the rain in the night.
Rain: a scene of the rain in the night.

sen.j: 夕焼け：夕日を反射した赤い水面と、同じく夕日を受けた事物の組み合わせ。
sen.e: Evening glow: a combination of the red surface of the water which reflects the evening sun and other object on which the evening sun also shines.
Evening glow: a combination of the red surface of the water which reflects the evening sun and other object on which the evening sun also shines.
Evening glow: a combination of the red surface of the water which reflects the evening sun and other object on which the evening sun also shines.

sen.j: 帆：夕暮れの中を舟が一斉に港に戻る風景。
sen.e: Sail: an evening scene in which ships go back to the port all at once.
Sail: an evening scene in which ships go back to the port all at once.
Sail: an evening scene in which ships go back to the port all at once.

sen.j: 月：秋の夜の月と、それが水面に反射する姿の組み合わせ。
sen.e: Moon: a combination of the moon in the autumn night and its reflection on the surface of the water.
Moon: a combination of the fall night moon and its reflection on the surface of the water.
Moon: a combination of the fall night moon and its reflection on the surface of the water.

sen.j: 雁：広い空間で飛ぶ雁の群れ。
sen.e: Goose: a flock of geese flying in a wide open space.
Goose: a flock of geese flying in wide open spaces.
Goose: a flock of geese flying in wide open spaces.

sen.j: 雪：夕方ないし夜の、雪が積もった山。
sen.e: Snow: a mountain covered with snow in the evening or night.
Snow: a mountain covered with snow in the evening or night.
Snow: a mountain covered with snow in the evening or night.

sen.j: 個々の項目の具体例を挙げると、近江八景の「石山の秋月」のように「石山」（対象となる地）と「秋月」（その地で見られる事象）のようになる。
sen.e: To give a concrete example of a head, the Eight Views of Omi has 'Autumn Moon at Ishiyama' (written as 石山秋月), which consists of 'Ishiyama (石山)' (the site of the scene) and 'Autumn Moon (秋月)' (the phenomenon at the site).
sen.cmt: 原文は「石山の秋月」となっていますが、次の行に「漢字4文字」との記述があり、また「の」をつけないのがもともとの形であるため、訳文には「石山秋月」と表記しました。
sen.e: To give a concrete example of a component of Eight Views, the Eight Views of Omi has 'Autumn Moon at Ishiyama' (written as 石山秋月), which consists of 'Ishiyama (石山)' (the site of the scene) and 'Fall Moon (秋月)' (a phenomenon at the site).

To give a concrete example of a component of Eight Views, the Eight Views of Omi has 'Autumn Moon at Ishiyama' (written as 石山秋月), which consists of 'Ishiyama (石山)' (the site of the scene) and 'Fall Moon (秋月)' (a phenomenon at the site).

sen.j: この際、瀟湘八景と同様に前2句+後2句の漢字4文字となるように項目名が設定されることが多い（例：金沢八景）。
sen.e: In many cases, as with Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang, the head is named with four Kanji (Chinese characters): two for the first half, and two four the latter half (example: Eight Views of Kanazawa).
In many cases, as with the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, the item name is made up of four Kanji (Chinese characters): the first pair and the latter pair (e.g. "金沢八景" Eight Views of Kanazawa).
In many cases, as with the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang, the item name is made up of four Kanji (Chinese characters): the first pair and the latter pair (e.g. "金沢八景" Eight Views of Kanazawa).

sen.j: 一方で日本新八景などは対象地のみを選び、そこでの事象・事物は指定していない。
sen.e: On the other hand, for Japan New Eight Views and so on, only the sites are selected and no phenomenon nor object there is specified.
On the other hand, for the New Eight Views of Japan and so on, only the sites are selected and neither phenomenon nor object there is specified.
On the other hand, for the New Eight Views of Japan and so on, only the sites are selected and neither phenomenon nor object there is specified.

sen.j: また、事象を含む項目と地名のみの項目が混在した八景もある。
sen.e: For some other Eight Views, some heads include phenomenon and others only have the site name.
Some Eight Views comprise a mixture of items including phenomena and those including only place names.
Some Eight Views comprise a mixture of items including phenomena and those including only place names.

sen.j: 日本には中世の16世紀頃から、朝鮮では高麗末期の14世紀頃から概念が受容されたという。
sen.e: The concept of Eight Views have been accepted since the 16th century of medieval period in Japan, and the 14th century in the last years of Goryeo in Korea.
The concept of Eight Views was accepted in medieval Japan from around the 16th century, and in Korea from around the 14th century in the late Goryeo period.
The concept of Eight Views was accepted in medieval Japan from around the 16th century, and in Korea from around the 14th century in the late Goryeo period.

sen.j: 瀟湘八景が書画から始まった事もあり、好んで絵画の題材とされてきた。
sen.e: Partly because Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang originated from calligraphic works and paintings, Eight Views have been the favorable subject matter of paintings.
Partly because Eight Views of Xiaoxiang originated from calligraphic works and paintings, Eight Views have been the favorable subject matter of paintings.
Partly because Eight Views of Xiaoxiang originated from calligraphic works and paintings, Eight Views have been the favorable subject matter of paintings.

sen.j: また、詩歌にうたわれた例も多い。
sen.e: They also have been written in many poetries.
They also have been described in many poetries.
They also have been described in many poetries.

sen.j: 日本では、瀟湘八景に直接影響を受けて考案された近江八景が最初の例とされる。
sen.e: In Japan, the Eight Views of Omi which was originated under the direct influence of Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang is considered to be the first example.
In Japan, the Eight Views of Omi which was originated under the direct influence of the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang is considered to be the first example.
In Japan, the Eight Views of Omi which was originated under the direct influence of the Eight Views of Xiaoxiang is considered to be the first example.

sen.j: 各地には多くの八景があり、全国の400カ所以上に八景が存在する。
sen.e: There are many kinds of Eight Views in various places, and there are the ones in more than 400 places all over Japan.
Eight Views exist in various places, and more concretely, in more than 400 places across Japan.
Eight Views exist in various places, and more concretely, in more than 400 places across Japan.

sen.j: 江戸時代に制定されたものが最も多く、浮世絵の連作のために考案された江戸八景などがある。
sen.e: Many Eight Views were established in Edo period, including Eight Views of Edo which was originated for a series of Japanese woodblock prints.
Many Eight Views were established in the Edo period, including Eight Views of Edo which was designed for a series of Ukiyo-e (Japanese woodblock prints).
Many Eight Views were established in the Edo period, including Eight Views of Edo which was designed for a series of Ukiyo-e (Japanese woodblock prints).

sen.j: 瀟湘八景
sen.e: Eight Views of the Xiao and the Xiang
Eight Views of Xiaoxiang

sen.j: 黄山八勝
sen.e: Eight Views of Mount Huang
Eight Views of Mount Huang
Eight Views of Mount Huang

sen.j: 金州古八景
sen.e: Eight Views of Old Jinzhou
sen.cmt: 原文には「金州金州古八景」とありますが、ウェブで確認すると用語が「金州古八景」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: Eight Views of Old Jinzhou

sen.e: Eight Views of Luda (present-day Dalian)
